definition: Chen Yun (1905-1995), communist leader and economist
surname Chen/Chen (c. 1045 - 479 BC), a Zhou dynasty state/Chen (557-589), one of the Southern Dynasties 南朝[Nan2 Chao2]
to lay out/to exhibit/to display/to narrate/to state/to explain/to tell/old/stale
cloud/CL:朵[duo3]
(classical) to say
surname Yun/abbr. for Yunnan Province 雲南省|云南省[Yun2 nan2 Sheng3]
Chen Yunlin (1941-), chairman of PRC Association for Relations Across the Taiwan Straits (ARATS) 海峽兩岸關係協會|海峡两岸关系协会[Hai3 xia2 Liang3 an4 Guan1 xi5 Xie2 hui4] (2008-2013)

sentences.english: This is a discussion of Chen Yun's theory of comprehensive balance.
sentences.chinese: 本文论述了陈云的综合平衡论思想。

sentences.english: Chen Yun is the first person who puts forward theory about planned economy and market regulation.
sentences.chinese: 陈云是提出计划经济与市场调节相结合理论的第一人。

sentences.english: "flew out on behalf of Chen Yun-yin, a" Hydrangea.
sentences.chinese: 陈云贤代表乘机抛出了一个“绣球”。

sentences.english: Article on Chen Yun's re-thinking of the real value of agriculture.
sentences.chinese: 文章对陈云的重农思想的现实价值进行了思考。

sentences.english: The DPP's chairwoman , Tsai Ing-wen, says her party will dog Mr Chen wherever he goes.
sentences.chinese: 民进党主席蔡英文说，民进党人会一直尾随陈云林。

sentences.english: During the meeting, Chen notably did not refer to Mr.
sentences.chinese: 在会议中陈云林并未称马为总统。

sentences.english: Cloud glances at the two men near her.
sentences.chinese: 陈云瞥了一眼坐在她近旁的两个人。

definition: Liu Shaoqi (1898-1969), Chinese communist leader, a martyr of the Cultural Revolution
Peng Zhen (1902-1997), Chinese communist leader
Yang Shangkun (1907-1998), former president of PRC and military leader
Zhang Wentian (1900-1976), CCP party leader and theorist
Wang Zhen (1908-1993), Chinese political figure
Li Fuchun (1900-1975), communist politician
Zhou Enlai (1898-1976), Chinese communist leader, prime minister 1949-1976
Deng Xiaoping (1904-1997), Chinese communist leader, de facto leader of PRC 1978-1990 and creator of "socialism with Chinese characteristics"
Dong Biwu (1886-1975), one of the founders of the Chinese communist party
Zhang Chunqiao (1917-2005), one of the Gang of Four
Chen Yi (1901-1972), communist general and politician, Marshal of PLA from 1955, Mayor of Shanghai in 1950s, PRC foreign minister 1958-1972
Hu Yaobang (1915-1989), Chinese politician
Mao Zedong (1893-1976), Chinese communist leader
Chen Boda (1904-1989), communist party theorist, interpreter of Maoism
Zhu De (1886-1976), communist leader and founder of the People's Liberation Army
Kang Sheng (1896-1975), Chinese communist leader, a politburo member during the Cultural Revolution and posthumously blamed for some of its excesses
